TopicTitle: been trying to fix myself, no luck.

Articles.Content:
ok, been trying to fix some crashes for a week of two now, can't seem to pin down the mod. as for reproduction steps, just play for a while, and wait for it to freeze. mods i use are:

USI Tools - 0.3.1

Asteroid Recycling Tech - 0.6

Community Resource Pack - 0.3.2

Flight Manager for Reusable Stages [FMRS] - 0.3.2

Ferram Aerospace Research - 0.14.6

Firespitter - 7.0

KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5

Kerbal Engineer Redux 1.0 - 1.0.14.1

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement - 3.1.1

RCS Build Aid - 0.5.5

RemoteTech - 1.6.2

SCANsat - 1.0.9.41

Trajectories - 1.1.3

Kerbal Alarm Clock - 3.2.3

USI Exploration Pack - 0.3.1

better buoyancy 1.1

crossfeed enabler 3.2

hydrogenNTRS

KAS 4.10

KVV 0.0.4

ModuleRCSFX 0.3

navball docking alignment indicator v6

procedural farings 3.11

showall fuels v1

stock bugfix modules v0.1.7d

toadicus tools v4

tweakable Everything 1.7

near future propulsion .0.4.0

active texture management 64x agressive r4-3

https://www.dropbox.com/s/87uembhvr05s3yk/KSP.log?dl=0 (ksp.log)

https://www.dropbox.com/s/lpsloycd0hx40qp/Player.log?dl=0 (player.log)

any help would be appreciated.

Edited January 28, 2015 by toric5

You're running out of memory:

KSP(12305,0xa10621d4) malloc: *** mach_vm_map(size=1048576) failed (error code=3)*** error: can't allocate region

*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug

Receiving unhandled NULL exception

Try Active Texture Management (x86 Aggressive version). It will take forever for KSP to load the first time after you install ATM, but starting from the second run, it should load faster, especially if you install the most recent version of Module Manager.
using 64x aggressive version, and it was using 1.3 gigs when it crashed (i still had 3 gigs of room on my machine.) ill try the 86x aggressive, though.

using 64x aggressive version, and it was using 1.3 gigs when it crashed (i still had 3 gigs of room on my machine.) ill try the 86x aggressive, though.

That might be your problem. KSP on OS X is 32-bit only.

there is no 32x version. the other one is 86x. i have the feeling that those numbers don't have to do with the bit versions. (if thats what you call them)

- - - Updated - - -

well, just saw the thread below me, i guess it probably is memory. don't trust activity monitor. trying ATM 86x now.

Edited January 28, 2015 by toric5
well, been messing around with ATM, and it works to a point. still have to count the number of times i can load or save a vehicle before the next crash...
